Learn more Take a tour JavaScript logo Curl logo Ruby logo Python logo Go logo PHP logo Java logo C# logo // using Twilio SendGrid's v3 Node.js Library // https://github.com/sendgrid/sendgrid-nodejs const sgMail = require('@sendgrid/mail'); sgMail.setApiKey(process.env.SENDGRID_API_KEY); const msg = { to: 'test@example.com', from: 'test@example.com', subject: 'Sending with Twilio SendGrid is Fun', text: 'and easy to do anywhere, even with Node.js', html: 'and easy to do anywhere, even with Node.js', }; sgMail.send(msg); curl --request POST \ --url https://api.sendgrid.com/v3/mail/send \ --header "Authorization: Bearer $SENDGRID_API_KEY" \ --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \ --data '{"personalizations": [{"to": [{"email": "test@example.com"}]}],"from": {"email": "test@example.com"},"subject": "Sending with SendGrid is Fun","content": [{"type": "text/plain", "value": "and easy to do anywhere, even with cURL"}]}' # using SendGrid's Ruby Library # https://github.com/sendgrid/sendgrid-ruby require 'sendgrid-ruby' include SendGrid from = Email.new(email: 'test@example.com') to = Email.new(email: 'test@example.com') subject = 'Sending with SendGrid is Fun' content = Content.new(type: 'text/plain', value: 'and easy to do anywhere, even with Ruby') mail = Mail.new(from, subject, to, content) sg = SendGrid::API.new(api_key: ENV['SENDGRID_API_KEY']) response = sg.client.mail._('send').post(request_body: mail.to_json) puts response.status_code puts response.body puts response.headers # using SendGrid's Python Librar

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Hi, my name is Alex and I'm reaching out from DeepData AI. We're a data processing solution that helps companies like yours optimize their data infrastructure and gain valuable insights. I came across your company, Twilio SendGrid, and noticed that you're handling a massive volume of emails every month. I'd love to explore how our solution can help you streamline your data processing and improve deliverability.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (skeptical) Ah, another sales call. What makes you think we need your solution? We already have a robust infrastructure in place for handling emails.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I understand that you have a solid foundation, but our solution can help you take it to the next level. We've worked with similar companies in the past and have seen significant improvements in data processing efficiency and cost savings. For example, one of our clients was able to reduce their data processing time by 30% and save $100,000 in infrastructure costs. I'd love to discuss how we can help you achieve similar results.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (still skeptical) I'm not sure we're looking to invest in a new solution right now. We're in the middle of a major migration to Twilio.com, and our priorities are focused on that. Plus, I'm not convinced that your solution would integrate seamlessly with our existing infrastructure.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I completely understand your concerns, and I appreciate your honesty. However, our solution is designed to be highly adaptable and can integrate with a wide range of systems. We've worked with companies that have complex infrastructure, and we've been able to integrate our solution without disrupting their operations. As for the timing, I'd argue that our solution could actually help you optimize your data processing during this migration period, making the transition smoother and more efficient.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (firmly) I appreciate your pitch, but I'm afraid we're not interested in exploring your solution at this time. We have a lot on our plate with the migration, and we can't take on any new projects or vendors. Maybe send me an email with some more information, and I'll review it when I have some more time.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I understand, and I respect your decision. However, I want to make sure you have all the information you need to make an informed decision. Can I send you a personalized demo link that showcases how our solution can help Twilio SendGrid specifically?

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (definitively) No, thank you. We're not interested in a demo or any further discussion at this time. Please don't follow up with me or my team. We're just not a good fit for your solution.

analysis.raw:
Score: 2
Outcome: Failure
Key_Objection: Timing
Feedback: The seller should have more thoroughly addressed the buyer's concerns about timing and migration priorities earlier in the conversation to potentially change the outcome. Sentiment: Negative

parsed.feedback: The seller should have more thoroughly addressed the buyer's concerns about timing and migration priorities earlier in the conversation to potentially change the outcome. Sentiment: Negative
